@graph.caption: molcajete with salsa with radishes, green onion, avocado and watercress on table

@graph.name: Watercress and Radish Salsa « Dora's Table
@graph.description: This vegan recipe for watercress and radish salsa is spicy, crunchy, fresh and pairs perfectly with avocado slices and home-made tortillas.

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Watercress and Radish Salsa
@graph.description: am in love with this watercress and radish salsa. I guess it's more of a salad with the addition of the radish and watercress, but it pairs so perfectly with the slices if avocado and home-made tortillas.
recipeIngredient: 3  Mexican spring onions (white part only, chopped, cebollitas)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a griddle or cast iron pan to high heat. Place tomatoes and serrano peppers on griddle until they become soft and slightly blackened, about 5 min.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a griddle or cast iron pan to high heat. Place tomatoes and serrano peppers on griddle until they become soft and slightly blackened, about 5 min.

recipeInstructions.text: Flip peppers, tomatoes, and continue to char for another 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Flip peppers, tomatoes, and continue to char for another 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove ingredients from griddle and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove ingredients from griddle and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Start grinding the peppers in the molcajete one at a time. Once the desired consistency is reached, add the tomatoes one by one and keep grinding. Set aside
recipeInstructions.name: Start grinding the peppers in the molcajete one at a time. Once the desired consistency is reached, add the tomatoes one by one and keep grinding. Set aside

recipeInstructions.text: If you do not have a molcajete you can use a blender or food processor. Simply place the charred tomatoes and peppers in the machine and pulse until the desired consistency is reached. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: If you do not have a molcajete you can use a blender or food processor. Simply place the charred tomatoes and peppers in the machine and pulse until the desired consistency is reached. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Add radish, watercress, and spring onion to the tomato and serrano salsa. Season with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Add radish, watercress, and spring onion to the tomato and serrano salsa. Season with salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with avocado slices and warm tortillas.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve with avocado slices and warm tortillas.
